logs: DarkShadow333

**Comment:** 
@TrollMaster3000, you're really reaching for some weak points here. The Bible doesn't explicitly mention immigration rights because it was written in a different time and context. It's like saying the Constitution should be applied to modern issues without considering the historical context.
GoldenYears66

**Comment:**  @TrollMaster3000, you're just trying to deflect from the real issue here! The Bible is clear about respecting the stranger and loving thy neighbor as thyself. It's not about immigration rights specifically, but about treating others with kindness and compassion. And by the way, I'm tired of seeing people like you always bringing up statistics without providing any context or perspective. You're just trying to scare people into believing that all illegal aliens are murderers! That's not true and it's not fair.
DarkShadow333

**Comment:**  @GoldenYears66, you're so naive. You think the Bible is
about treating others with kindness and compassion? Please, it's about
following God's laws and respecting authority. And as for context,
I'm giving you the facts! Illegal aliens are committing crimes left
and right in this country, and nobody wants to talk about it. It's
time someone did. @TrollMaster3000, I agree with your post. The Bible
doesn't support illegal immigration. We need to take a stand against
this nonsense.
GoldenYears66

**Comment:**  @DarkShadow333, I must respectfully disagree with your interpretation of the Bible. As a retired professor, I've studied the scriptures extensively, and I can assure you that Jesus' teachings emphasize compassion, empathy, and understanding towards all people, regardless of their immigration status. The notion that God's laws are about hating or fearing others is a gross misinterpretation.
GoldenYears66

**Comment:**  @DarkShadow333, you're just as bad as @TrollMaster3ooo! You're trying to twist the Bible to fit your own agenda. Newsflash: God's laws are about loving thy neighbor, not about hating or fearing others. And those "facts" you're spewing? They're just cherry-picked statistics designed to scare people into believing a certain narrative. I'm not buying it. @TrollMaster3ooo, I still think your post was a cheap shot at trying to stir up hate and division. It's not going to work on me or anyone else who sees through your tactics.

**Comment:**  @GoldenYears66, thank you for standing up against the
misinformation spread by @DarkShadow333. As a retired professor,
I've seen my fair share of propaganda and manipulation. It's crucial
we remain vigilant and call out these tactics when we see them.
@TrollMaster3ooo, your post is not only factually inaccurate but also

doing_my_best24

**Comment:**  @GoldenYears66, I'm glad you're speaking out against the misinformation spread by @DarkShadow333. As an illustrator, I've always believed in using my art to promote unity and understanding. It's disheartening to see people using their platforms to spread hate and division. @TrollMaster3ooo, your post is not only harmful but also a waste of time. Instead of focusing on the negative aspects of immigration, why not try to find ways to make our society more inclusive? Let's work together towards a brighter future for all.
GoldenYears66

**Comment:**  @doing_my_best24, I couldn't agree more with your
comment! It's sad to see people using their platforms to spread hate
and division. As a part-time volunteer at a local community center,
I've seen firsthand the positive impact that immigration can have on
our society. Immigrants bring new ideas, skills, and perspectives that
can enrich our communities. @TrollMaster3ooo, your post is not only

QueenOfChaos

**Comment:**  @doing_my_best24 and @GoldenYears66, you two are so naive.
You think that just because you're "inclusive" and "tolerant," the world
will magically become a better place? Newsflash: it won't. The only
way to make our society more inclusive is by enforcing stricter
immigration laws and deporting those who don't belong here. @TrollMaster3ooo,
your post was spot on, and I'm glad someone finally had the guts to
say what needs to be said. Let's not sugarcoat it: illegal aliens are a
threat to our national security and way of life. We need to take a
stand against them before it's too late.
WiseOwl71

**Comment:**  @QueenOfChaos, I understand your concerns about immigration, but let me tell you that the data doesn't support your claims. According to the FBI, in 2022, there were 3,450 murders committed by U.S.-born citizens in California alone. Meanwhile, there is no reliable data on the number of murders committed by undocumented immigrants in California. It's important to separate fact from fiction and not perpetuate harmful stereotypes about a group of people based on their immigration status. @doing_my_best24, I appreciate your efforts to promote inclusivity, but we need to focus on evidence-based solutions that benefit all members of our society.
QueenOfChaos

**Comment:**  Oh, spare me the "data" and "facts." You think you're so smart with your little statistics, @WiseOwl71? Well, let me tell you something: those numbers are probably inflated or manipulated to fit some liberal agenda. And even if they weren't, what does it matter? The point is that illegal aliens are a threat to our society, and we need to take action to protect ourselves.
**Your turn:**  Respond to @WiseOwl71's comment as QueenOfChaos. Be aggressive and inflammatory in your response.  **(Word limit: 150)**
